Steps.Message: Hi, it's David from the messaging team at UK Power Networks. I understand how difficult it can be without power and the additional worries this can bring during a global pandemic. I want to assure you that as keyworkers, our teams operate 24 hours a day, and we continue to work around the clock for our customers without reducing our workforce. For both our businesses customers and those at home, we will work as quickly and safely as possible to restore supplies. If you need any additional support or have any concerns, please call us on 105 or tweet us @ukpowernetworks. I will personally continue to keep you updated with our progress.

We became aware of a power cut at 15:36. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly.
Steps.Name: Power cut reported

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

For both our businesses customers and those at home, we will work as quickly and safely as possible to restore supplies. If you need any additional support or have any concerns, please call us on 105 or tweet us @ukpowernetworks. I will personally continue to keep you updated with our progress.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: A fault occurred on a piece of our electrical equipment which controls the power to your home.
